derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from Latin cadmia 'calamine', so named because it is found with calamine in zinc ore. Compare with calamine

entry.def: Cadmium is a soft bluish-white metal that is used in the production of nuclear energy.

means.word_mean: 1. a soft bluish-white ductile malleable toxic bivalent metallic element; occurs in association with zinc ores
